headline: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash
summary: Microsoft has promised to pay higher utility bills for all of its U.S. data centers powering artificial-intelligence models, President Trump said Monday, accelerating plans by the tech industry and administration to respond to local fears that AI is pushing up electricity prices.  The software giant “will make major changes beginning this week to ensure that Americans don’t ‘pick up the tab’ for their power consumption,” Trump said on Truth Social.

content.title: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash

The software giant “will make major changes beginning this week to ensure that Americans don’t ‘pick up the tab’ for their power consumption,” Trump said on Truth Social.

headline: Investors back energy providers over big tech for 2026 AI bets, says BlackRock
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, still believes in the investment case ​for artificial intelligence in the year ahead but ‌will be focusing on broader opportunities, it said on Tuesday.  Investors seeking ‌to play the AI theme into 2026 favour energy and infrastructure providers over Wall Street big tech, BlackRock said in its Investment Directions report, citing a recent investor ⁠survey it conducted.  AI and ‌big tech dominated markets and world equity returns in 2025, but as the multitrillion-dollar ‍race between the likes of Microsoft, Meta and Alphabet to build new data centres generates worries about uncertain returns on capital ​and higher borrowing, investors were looking for new ‌ideas, the BlackRock survey showed.

content.title: Investors back energy providers over big tech for 2026 AI bets, says BlackRock
content.summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, still believes in the investment case ​for artificial intelligence in the year ahead but ‌will be focusing on broader opportunities, it said on Tuesday.  Investors seeking ‌to play the AI theme into 2026 favour energy and infrastructure providers over Wall Street big tech, BlackRock said in its Investment Directions report, citing a recent investor ⁠survey it conducted.  AI and ‌big tech dominated markets and world equity returns in 2025, but as the multitrillion-dollar ‍race between the likes of Microsoft, Meta and Alphabet to build new data centres generates worries about uncertain returns on capital ​and higher borrowing, investors were looking for new ‌ideas, the BlackRock survey showed.

headline: The trillion-dollar IPOs investors are watching for in 2026
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.Investors are buzzing over potential $1 trillion tech IPOs in 2026, but which giants will come out on top? In this episode of Stocks in Translation, The Futurum Group Daniel Newman joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to discuss the potential $1 trillion IPOs of OpenAI and SpaceX. Newman breaks down investor hype, competitive moats, and market risks, while also exploring Google (GOOG) Gemini’s AI gains, Apple's (AAPL) innovation gap, and how Amazon (AMZN) and Meta (META) are positioned to dominate AI in 2026.Check out the full episode here. Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.

Investors are buzzing over potential $1 trillion tech IPOs in 2026, but which giants will come out on top?

Check out the full episode here.

headline: AI Data Center Demand Leaves No Stone Unturned With New Geothermal Deal
summary: Geothermal and renewable energy company Ormat Technologies reported late Monday it signed a 20-year power purchase agreement with AI data center designer/builder Switch.  Under the deal, Switch will purchase approximately 13 megawatts of renewable energy from Ormat's Salt Wells geothermal power plant located near Fallon, Nevada.

On Saturday, Cuban reignited his crusade for healthcare reform by highlighting what he sees as a glaring pricing failure. headline: Bill Gates Says 'AI Will Change Society the Most'—Job Disruption Has Already Begun, 'Less Labor' Will Be Needed, And 5-Day Work Week May Disappear
summary: Bill Gates says he's still optimistic about the future—but this time, he brought disclaimers. In his latest annual The Year Ahead letter, published on GatesNotes last week, the Microsoft co-founder and philanthropist laid out what he calls "optimism with footnotes." At the top of those footnotes: artificial intelligence, and the profound impact he believes it's already having on work. "AI capabilities will allow us to make far more goods and services with less labor," Gates wrote. "We're already

headline: 'Big Short' Investor Michael Burry Bets Against Oracle—Here's His Advice
summary: Michael Burry, the investor who famously bet against the US housing market during the 2008 financial crisis, has turned bearish on Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL). headline: Meta mulls doubling output of Ray-Ban glasses by year end, Bloomberg News reports
summary: Meta and EssilorLuxottica are considering doubling the production capacity of their artificial intelligence-powered smart glasses to 20 ​million units annually by the end of this year, Bloomberg ‌News reported on Tuesday.  The eyewear giant said in October it would accelerate production capacity for the booming smart ​glasses business.  The latest report comes as Meta is cutting more than 1,000 jobs from the company's Reality Labs division, ‍according to a ⁠separate Bloomberg News report.

content.title: Meta mulls doubling output of Ray-Ban glasses by year end, Bloomberg News reports
content.summary: Meta and EssilorLuxottica are considering doubling the production capacity of their artificial intelligence-powered smart glasses to 20 ​million units annually by the end of this year, Bloomberg ‌News reported on Tuesday.  The eyewear giant said in October it would accelerate production capacity for the booming smart ​glasses business.  The latest report comes as Meta is cutting more than 1,000 jobs from the company's Reality Labs division, ‍according to a ⁠separate Bloomberg News report.

headline: Meta Seeks to Increase Ray-Ban AI-Glasses Output, Cut Jobs
summary: Meta Platforms and EssilorLuxottica are discussing potentially doubling production capacity for AI-powered smart glasses by the end of this year. Meta previously announced it is cutting more than 1,000 jobs from the Reality Labs division as part of a plan to redirect resources toward AI wearables and phone features. Ed Ludlow has more on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

Ed Ludlow has more on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

headline: Meta Begins Job Cuts as It Shifts From Metaverse to AI Devices
summary: Affected employees will be notified of the layoffs starting Tuesday morning, according to an internal post from Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth that was reviewed by Bloomberg News.  The cuts are expected to hit roughly 10% of employees within the Reality Labs group, which has about 15,000 workers, Bloomberg reported earlier this week.

headline: Microsoft announces glut of new data centers but says it won’t let your electricity bill go up
summary: The tech giant has pledged to be a "good neighbor" as it continues to invest in AI infrastructure throughout the country.

content.title: Microsoft announces glut of new data centers but says it won’t let your electricity bill go up
content.summary: The tech giant has pledged to be a "good neighbor" as it continues to invest in AI infrastructure throughout the country.

headline: Trump's $1.5 Trillion Military Budget Is Sending This Drone Stock Soaring: Momentum Score Spikes
summary: President Donald Trump’s pledge to increase the country’s military budget from $900 billion to $1.5 trillion has sent defense stocks soaring, including robotics and drone solutions provider, Red Cat Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:RCAT), over the past week. Shares of Red Cat Holdings are up 41.70% year-to-date, in just over a week of trading in the new year, a surge that is sending its Momentum score in Benzinga’s Edge Stock Rankings soaring. headline: Trump’s power play risks slowing US in AI arms race
summary: Investing.com -- President Donald Trump’s latest push to shield Americans from higher power bills risks colliding with Washington’s drive to stay ahead in the AI arms race, with Wedbush warning that forcing Big Tech to “pay their own way” on soaring electricity costs could slow the buildout of data centers that underpin the AI boom.

content.title: Trump’s power play risks slowing US in AI arms race
content.summary: Investing.com -- President Donald Trump’s latest push to shield Americans from higher power bills risks colliding with Washington’s drive to stay ahead in the AI arms race, with Wedbush warning that forcing Big Tech to “pay their own way” on soaring electricity costs could slow the buildout of data centers that underpin the AI boom.

headline: As ‘agentic commerce’ gains ground, companies shouldn’t put too much faith in ‘GEO,’ one industry insider warns
summary: Research from AIVO Standard shows that AI models are inconsistent and unreliable in answering questions about a company's finances or governance standards, key inputs to enterprise purchasing or lending decisions

content.title: As ‘agentic commerce’ gains ground, companies shouldn’t put too much faith in ‘GEO,’ one industry insider warns
content.summary: Research from AIVO Standard shows that AI models are inconsistent and unreliable in answering questions about a company's finances or governance standards, key inputs to enterprise purchasing or lending decisions

thumbnail.caption: Earlier this week, Google rolled out new commerce features for Google Search's AI Mode and its Gemini chatbot. Brands increasingly want to monitor and control how they show up to AI agents and in AI-mediated queries. But experts warn that not all queries are the same and that AI models present risks when it comes to queries related to a company's finances or governance standards, which could influence major procurement decisions.

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Powered Down
summary: The Dow fell 398 points while the S&P 500 slipped 0.2%.  Oil prices jumped after President Trump appeared to hint at intervening in Iran's continuing internal upheaval.  President Trump wants the tech giants building massive artificial-intelligence data centers to "pay their own way" and not have higher energy bills fall on consumers because of booming AI data-center consumption.

content.title: Heard on the Street Recap: Powered Down
content.summary: The Dow fell 398 points while the S&P 500 slipped 0.2%.  Oil prices jumped after President Trump appeared to hint at intervening in Iran's continuing internal upheaval.  President Trump wants the tech giants building massive artificial-intelligence data centers to "pay their own way" and not have higher energy bills fall on consumers because of booming AI data-center consumption.
